intro: Melampyrum pratense f. angustifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved yellow loosestrife, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Orobanchaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves that are typically narrower than the standard form. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It is often found in moist meadows and along stream banks, thriving in nutrient-rich soils. This fern-like plant is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
